Package pieces

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • pieces.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class that describes a generic chess pieces
    Author:
    Sreekar Vedula, Quan Li

      Piece​(int row, int col, boolean white)
      Creates a new piece object with the specified parameters

    • Constructor Detail

      • Piece

        public Piece​(int row,
             int col,
             boolean white)
        Creates a new piece object with the specified parameters
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the piece on the chess board
        col - The column of the piece on the chess board
        white - True if the piece is white, false if black

    • Method Detail

      • isWhite

        public boolean isWhite()
        Gets the color of the current piece
        Returns:
        True if white, false if black

      • setCoordinates

        public void setCoordinates​(int row,
                           int col)
        Updates the row and column fields of the piece
        Parameters:
        row - The current row
        col - The current column

      • getRow

        public int getRow()
        Gets the current row
        Returns:
        Row on board from 1-8

      • getCol

        public int getCol()
        Gets the current column
        Returns:
        Column on board from 1-8

      • isMoveLegal

        public abstract boolean isMoveLegal​(int endRow,
                                    int endCol,
                                    Piece[][] board)
        Determines whether the specified move is legal for the piece type
        Parameters:
        endRow - The destination row of the move
        endCol - The destination column of the move
        board - The game board which holds all the pieces
        Returns:
        True if the move is legal, false if illegal
